items.content:
Join an online revolution to reduce teacher workload whilst increasing student performance at secondary school level!

Get My Grades is a hard-working, driven team of developers and educators who have been working together to design the ultimate educational platform. We are passionate about using our experience in education and the latest technology together to reduce teacher workload and enhance students’ online learning experience. Now that we have succeeded in launching our platform to students, parents, tutors, and teachers, we are looking to expand our core team so that together, we can continue improving the fantastic service we offer to our clients worldwide. Read more about what it is like to work for Get My Grades here: https://www.getmygrades.co.uk/aboutus/careers/

The Role:
We're looking for a Senior QA to take the lead on setting the foundations of automated testing and join our growing development team as we scale up our operations. Our current technologies are VueJS (frontend), Laravel PHP (backend) and AWS. You will be responsible for:
* Setting up the end-to-end test framework with an ambitious agile/scrum development team.
* Working together with our current manual tester, Bryden, to proactively identify bugs using automation tests.
* Implementing an excellent test pipeline, including smoke testing, API testing, regression testing, integration testing etc.
* Be a committed Get My Grades ambassador and a member of our team that learns and grows together, embracing diversity and extreme intellectual curiosity.

Desired Skills and Experience:
* QA Automation Engineer / Automation Test Engineer / Engineer in Test with demonstrable experience in setting up QA testing strategy as well as applying testing processes and techniques (manual and automation) in large scale software projects.
* Experience working with Frontend UIs using Selenium, Cucumber, Gherkin, Eggplant, Protractor, Mocha and/ or Chai.
* Proven expertise with database technologies like MongoDB and SQL performing various queries and/or updates for testing purposes.
* Experience with running tests on the cloud e.g. AWS
* Enthusiastic, independent, capable individual who can write clean code in Javascript.
* You’re motivated and have great organisational and communication skills.
* You’re curious, and love to learn and try new technologies.
* You know your limits and how to work on a deadline.
* You work well in a test-driven, agile team.
* You are a problem-solver with an inquisitive and innovative mind.
* You are able to take on the new challenges ahead together with the growing business.

Our current stack:
Front End – VueJS
Back End – PHP (Laravel)
Server – AWS
Database – MYSQL data structure with Amazon Aurora
Analytics – Matomo
Landing Site – WordPress (currently, but looking to migrate)
CRM/Email Service – HubSpot

What You Get:
* Competitive Salary – Tell us what will make you happy and we will accommodate for the right candidate!
* Share options.
* Access to our Company Bonus Scheme.
* Pension.
* 25 days holiday plus 8 UK bank holidays.
* A ‘perks at work’ recognition package.
* Fresh fruit every day (or biscuits).
* A fully functional luxury tea and coffee machine, always at your service!
* An office based in central Woolwich, SE18.

How to apply
If you are interested in this opportunity please get in touch and email Sam with your CV and cover letter to HR. Please do not apply if you are looking for a remote role, or if you are a recruiter.

This role is full-time, 8:45-5:30pm, Monday-Friday based in our office.

Job description

What you’ll do
You'll communicate with stakeholders across different teams to improve technical processes and tooling in our Filters department. Support the blocking of non-acceptable ads and help counter adblock circumvention. With your knowledge in automation and creative freedom, you'll develop solutions to upcoming issues and move forward.

After your morning coffee, you’ll be expected to...

  • Develop solutions for automated crawling of web content and monitoring of ads to asses ad blocking quality
  • Work on automating pushes to the anti-circumvention filter list in response to common circumvention methods
  • Support any innovation initiatives around monitoring, like machine learning, with technical expertise
  • Create, maintain and improve technical processes, including tooling and documentation
  • Improve team communication and sync with your colleagues to make sure everybody is always updated


A little bit about you...

  • 4+ years experience in software development
  • Good knowledge of JavaScript (especially Node.js)
  • Strongly process- and quality-oriented
  • Experience with agile methodologies
  • Basic DevOps knowledge, e.g. Docker
  • Proficient user of spoken and written English

It's great, but not required, if you have...

  • A university degree (incl. Applied sciences) in information science or related
  • Knowledge of additional scripting languages
  • Experience with multi-lingual/multi-cultural teams
  • Experience in Machine Learning

A little bit about the team you’ll work with
You’ll join the Filters department and work in the Circumvention and Filterlists Teams. We’re proud to unite people from diverse backgrounds in our cross-functional teams. We all have our niche expertise and projects we work on and that means we can support each other if somebody gets stuck with an issue. Right now, we’re all about improving and automating processes. Join us if you want to become part of a great team that makes a difference in the web ecosystem.

A lot of our eyeo colleagues work remotely and so can you. We’re happy to pay for a coworking space, or if you prefer we can help you relocate to our offices in Cologne or Berlin.

Get to know us
We create open source software that puts users in control of their online browsing experience. Our desktop and mobile products, such as Adblock Plus, Adblock Browser and Flattr, help sustain and grow a fair, open web, giving users control while providing user-friendly monetization. Our most popular product, Adblock Plus (ABP), is currently used on over 100 million devices.

Not sure if this is for you? Consider contributing first.

Apply now

  • Home Office & Remote Work
  • Slack Time (Keep your technical skills up to date)
  • Subway Ticket (Travel for free in Cologne or Berlin)
  • Games! (foosball, flipper, ping-pong, PS4 & VR-games provided)
  • Diverse International Team
  • Paid Relocation (we support your move to Germany in any way we can)

items.content:
Quality Assurance Analyst at Pulse8

Remote

Reports to: Director of Pharmacy Product Development

Location: Remote Position

About Pulse8, Inc.

Pulse8 is an innovative Healthcare Analytics and Technology Company that delivers visibility and transparency for Risk Adjustment, Quality and Pharmacy management programs. We enable health plans and at-risk providers to achieve the greatest financial impact in the Commercial, Health Insurance Exchange, Medicare Advantage, and Medicaid markets.

By combining advanced analytic methodologies with extensive health plan experience, Pulse8 is developing a suite of uniquely pragmatic solutions to change the game in pharmacy benefit management and to compliment the core solutions that are revolutionizing risk adjustment. Pulse8’s flexible business intelligence tools offer near real-time visibility into member, prescriber and pharmacy activity/pricing so our clients can ensure cost-effective, high quality, and clinically appropriate use of the pharmacy benefit.

What’s cool about working for Pulse8? 
We’re a close knit team of Healthcare and Technology experts dedicated to helping people live longer, healthier lives. You’ll get to help us design and build innovative solutions from the ground up and can do lots of interesting things in an entrepreneurial culture. We offer competitive benefits and much, much more!

Position Description

The Formul8 Quality Assurance Analyst will work collaboratively with Pulse8 development and delivery teams to ensure a high quality application is delivered to customers. The Quality Assurance Analyst will lead and enhance a comprehensive quality assurance program and provide full review and approval of new development, product enhancements and client production runs.

Position Responsibilities

  1. Develop and Maintain a Robust Quality Assurance Program
    1. Solidify and improve the current quality assurance program supporting our pharmacy application development and delivery process
    2. Maintain the policies and procedures that govern the process and educate the teams regarding their content and purpose
    3. Work collaboratively with the Pulse8 quality team to share and capture best practices to support continuous improvement of the pharmacy program
  2. Development Process Support
    1. Work closely with the Formul8 development team to ensure the quality assurance process is in place and adhered to including: SME to SME reviews, Developer to Developer Reviews are completed ahead of QA Analyst testing
    2. Develop and maintain test cases and acceptance criteria for each Formul8 dashboard
    3. Perform quality assurance tests based on the test cases and acceptance criteria defined in both the development and demo environments
    4. Document and report out findings and work collaboratively with the development team to correct any findings
  3. Delivery Process Support
    1. Work closely with the Formul8 delivery team to ensure the quality assurance process is in place and adhered to including: new customer implementations, one-time runs, and monthly data refreshes
    2. Develop and maintain test cases and acceptance criteria for each of the delivery processes to ensure adequate testing ahead of providing customer access to the application/dashboards
    3. Perform quality assurance tests based on the test cases and acceptance criteria defined in the production environments
    4. Document and report out findings and work collaboratively with the delivery team to correct any findings

Minimum Essential Knowledge / Skills:

  • 5+ years of experience completing quality assurance testing for a healthcare software development company – specifically writing and executing test cases and acceptance criteria
  • 3+ years of experience with Tableau, Sisense or similar business intelligence tool
  • Working knowledge of experience with SQL, SSIS and Java
  • Ability to work within a team environment

Required Education / Experience:

  • Bachelor’s degree in a related field of study – finance, software engineering, information systems
  • 5+ years of experience in healthcare industry
  • Pharmacy claims experience highly preferred
Apply for job

Company Profile
Morgan Stanley is a leading global financial services firm providing a wide range of investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. The Firm’s employees serve clients worldwide including corporations, governments and individuals from more than 1,200 offices in 43 countries.

As a market leader, the talent and passion of our people is critical to our success. Together, we share a common set of values rooted in integrity, excellence and strong team ethic. Morgan Stanley can provide a superior foundation for building a professional career – a place for people to learn, to achieve and grow. A philosophy that balances personal lifestyles, perspectives and needs is an important part of our culture.

Technology
Technology works as a strategic partner with Morgan Stanley business units and the world’s leading technology companies to redefine how we do business in ever more global, complex, and dynamic financial markets. Morgan Stanley’s sizeable investment in technology results in quantitative trading systems, cutting-edge modeling and simulation software, comprehensive risk and security systems, and robust client-relationship capabilities, plus the worldwide infrastructure that forms the backbone of these systems and tools. Our insights, our applications and infrastructure give a competitive edge to clients’ businesses ¢and to our own.

Quality Assurance and Production Management (QAPM) division is responsible for the Testing, Assurance and Application Support for a range of custom Front, Middle and Back office applications used to support the business processes within Morgan Stanley. We are looking for a hands-on QA Lead in the New York office to lead testing of projects across Risk Technology. You will be responsible for managing the testing delivery of multiple projects across Credit, Market, Operational and Liquidity risk applications. You will need to work closely with a global team of Developers, Business Analyst and Project Managers to manage QA testing on various regulatory driven projects. Any prior experience with supporting BASEL, CCAR, PRA, CECL deliverables would be a plus.

Primary Responsibilities
-Ensure timely delivery, thoroughly review test artifacts ensure testing gaps are addressed while meeting the defined standards on mandatory and critical projects and work towards improving these standards in an ongoing basis
-Communicate with developers, project managers, and management on project and testing status working across time zones
– Regularly interact with development teams with a view to propose and implement improvements.
-Develop a close understanding of existing automation frameworks and constantly scan opportunities for additional automation. Engage in DevOps initiatives within QA and Development teams to help implement efficiencies across both teams.
-Manage a small team and ensure that there is a strong pipeline of trained resources, partner with vendor delivery managers to ensure the resources are motivated, trained and replace /upgrade them as applicable
– Maintain solid understanding of software testing best practices, methodologies and terminology
– Participate in daily release /Project meetings as applicable
– Review QA metrics and ensure ALM is populated with metrics at right level of quality

Qualifications:

Skills Required
– 10+ years of Software Testing/Development experience within a technical environment
-5+ years of Software Testing/Development Management experience with responsibilities for running the testing function across a broad range of client projects
-Able to demonstrate process improvements across both QA and development teams under their control
-Demonstrated experience of both local and remote team liaison and management
-Experience of Backend and Frontend testing, Test automation using Selenium or other industry standard tools.
-Understanding of database testing and SQL queries
-Strong Written and Oral communication skills

Skills desired
-Experience in Defect management tooling (JIRA, ALM)
-Experience with performance testing frameworks
-Hands on Selenium automation skills along with exposure to TDD/BDD (Cucumber, Jbehave)
-Experience in DevOps CI/CD, Agile testing methodologies (Scrum, Safe)
-Domain skills or product knowledge
-Experience of Investment Banking working culture QA Lead – Firm Risk Management

Salary :

Minimum:
Maximum:
Currency: US Dollar . USD

items.content:
Junior Quality Assurance Tester at TeamSnap

Remote
  • United States
  • Full-Time
  • Entry Level

TeamSnap is seeking a Jr. QA Tester that exhaustively, obsessively and painstakingly tries to BREAK ALL THE THINGS. If you’re the kind of person who re-reads sent emails looking for typos, complains about movies because of continuity errors and has no qualms about repeatedly experimenting with a 50-ingredient chili recipe, this job may be for you. This role will report directly to the Manager of Quality Assurance.

About us

TeamSnap is an award-winning communication and management service for recreational and competitive sports teams, tournaments and organizations. With over 20 million enthusiastic customers in 195 countries, TeamSnap is indispensable for teams, clubs and leagues worldwide.

We value trust, communication and fun more than big company policies and rules, and we thrive on empowering our people instead of controlling them. TeamSnap has been named to Outside Magazine’s list of Best Places to Work three consecutive years.

What you’ll be doing

  • As a Jr. QA Tester you will work with our web and mobile teams to find, report and document obvious (and not-so-obvious) product bugs, usability issues and inconsistencies. You must have painstaking attention to detail, patience for repetitive work and a sleuth-like capacity for uncovering non-obvious problems.
  • Sometimes you will follow test scripts and sometimes you will be asked to write test scripts, but often you will be in uncharted waters and it will be up to you to find the rocky shoals that lie just beneath the surface. We play fast and loose with metaphors around here and we expect you to do the same.
  • This position requires the technical ability to install and run multiple web browsers on Mac and Windows, install and use software on iOS and Android devices and general computer proficiency and savvy. You are not expected to have computer programming skills or advanced technical knowledge.

Some things that are important:

  • 2-4 years of relevant QA experience: knowledge of the principles, practices and procedures of quality assurance testing and the ability to apply this knowledge and skills.
  • Possess a solid understanding of process flow and development; strong analytical thinking and problem-solving skills.
  • Attention to detail.
  • Keen organizational skills.
  • A relentless desire to find problems before our customers do.
  • Enough comfort with computers and mobile phones and software that you can quickly learn to install and use new software.
  • Strong decision-making skills, with the ability to prioritize and know where to focus.
  • Excellent communication skills.
  • Ability to write clearly and concisely.
  • A nice demeanor, but not a pushover. Sometimes you have to give developers bad news that their software broke, but in a friendly way.
  • Ability to think from a user’s perspective.
  • Basic interest and knowledge about team sports.
  • A no-compromises attitude towards quality.
  • Ability to work as part of a geographically-distributed development team
  • Flexibility, teamwork, sense of humor and the willingness to do what’s necessary to help a relatively small company grow quickly

Other things that would be nice to have:

  • Experience with Jira or similar.
  • Experience with Ghost Inspector or similar.
  • Experience in both Windows/Mac and Android/iOS. Being bi-platform is a definite bonus.
  • Experience in software development or design.
  • Ability to read through all of the bullet points.
  • Tons of old iPhone and Android phones just lying around your house.
  • Be a parent, coach or participant in a recreational sport
  • Be a TeamSnap user (sign up for a free trial to see what we’re about)
  • Ability to talk to animals, Doctor Doolittle-style

Location

  • We are headquartered in Boulder, Colorado, but this job is remote (unless you happen to live near Boulder, in which case you’re welcome to come to the office). TeamSnap is a mostly-distributed company, so you must be very comfortable working with people who aren’t in the same physical location as you or each other. While we love all parts of the world, we can only hire US-based citizens at this time.

Why TeamSnap?

  • Work on a product that people use and love
  • While we’re still relatively small, we’re not a fly-by-night startup; we’re the leader in a massive market
  • We have a proven revenue model, an experienced executive team, solid funding, and a strong strategic plan
  • We have fantastic benefits, and you’ll have a stake in the company

If you’re looking for an opportunity to show off the very best of your skills, in an environment of trust, respect and flexibility, this might very well be the best job you’ll ever have. We’re passionate about helping our customers spend less time organizing and more time playing.

Benefits and Perks

We offer competitive salary and benefits, lots of opportunity to develop professionally, and the ability to demonstrate what you can achieve. TeamSnap is still small enough that your actions will help drive our success. Benefits include:

  • Competitive salary
  • Medical/dental/vision for you and your family
  • Education reimbursement up to $1,500/yr
  • Wellness stipend of $50/mo
  • 401K
  • Free TeamSnap service for your family and friends
  • Free TeamSnap swag.
  • Flexible PTO and vacation policy

Diversity and Inclusion

TeamSnap is a company built around trust, kindness and collaboration, where diverse backgrounds, experiences and viewpoints are celebrated and valued. This is a place where everybody belongs.

Apply for job

items.content:
Associate Penetration Tester at Schellman & Company

Remote

at Schellman & Company, LLC

Tampa, FL

Breaking into your first penetration testing role can be difficult. We understand that you might have the talent, but just haven’t had the opportunity to transition to a full-time role. We’ve solved this problem by creating our own Associate Pen Test program. This is a rare opportunity to build on your offensive skillset while working with our team, whose unrivaled knowledge and experience will provide guidance and mentorship throughout. What do we ask from you? Unwavering commitment to learn as much as possible during the program and beyond, to become a contributing member of the team, and to always be up for a new challenge.

There is no typical day for our Pen Test team. Our clients rely on us to find a myriad of vulnerabilities across network, application, mobile, cloud, wireless and other assessments. The benefit of being exposed to so many different situations is that you are constantly building your knowledge base and skillset while keeping up with the latest cloud technologies and endpoint protection. Our team is remote yet extremely collaborative and works together to utilize their different backgrounds and experience to solve these problems.

In addition to the hands-on training, Schellman also promotes a continuous learning environment. Team members are encouraged to attend at least one security conference and training event every year to stay on the cutting edge of the industry.

Our ideal background for these roles:

  • Demonstrated enthusiasm for Information Security (e.g., GitHub repo, blogs, presentations, conference talks, local security association member, participated in free skill-building/hacking challenges – SANS Holiday Hack, HackerOne CTF, HackTheBox.eu, etc.)
  • The single-minded focus of establishing or furthering a career in penetration testing
  • At least two years of pen testing, software development, systems administration, or similar experience
  • At least two years hands-on technical security experience
  • Competency in common operating systems (e.g., Windows, macOS, Linux)
  • An understanding of cloud computing models, technologies, and concepts
  • Demonstrated entrepreneurial abilities, client focus, industry savvy, and the ability to work independently or as part of a collaborative team
  • Advanced written and verbal communication skills
  • Strong analytical and interpersonal characteristics
  • Ability to work both independently and collaboratively
  • Demonstrated consistency in values, principles, and work ethic
  • Self-driven in a remote working environment

Preferred:

  • Degree in computer science or information technology
  • Certifications within Information Technology or Information Security
Apply for job

items.content:
QA Engineer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior, Lead
Role: QA/Test Developer
Industry: Logistics & Distribution, Transportation, Vehicle Tracking
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: VC Funded
Company: SHARE | Columbus, OH

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT-05:00) Eastern Time
Office Location: Columbus, OH. Employees can also work full time from this office.

Technologies

testing
automation
cucumber
gherkin
automated-tests

Job description

SHARE is looking for a QA Engineer to join our growing team. We are looking for someone that wants to build great software products and a service that customers love.

Responsibilities

  • Collaborate with Product and Design on requirement gathering, user stories and persona development
  • Create and manage testing scripts for manually tested features
  • Be meticulous about documentation and maintaining a robust log of all test cases and test results
  • Coordinate with Product team on validating builds for release
  • Work to automate testing, where applicable, to accelerate testing and promote consistency
  • Stay current with the fast-changing landscape of manual/automated testing and best practices
  • Support and troubleshoot issues, identify root cause, and proactively work with developers to find sustainable solutions
  • Evaluate new and existing frameworks, technology, platforms, and tooling, as appropriate
  • Integrate test reporting into Jira, Confluence and other platforms
  • Drive quality standards for product

Experience and Skills

A candidate is expected to meet the following minimum requirements:

  • 3+ years in software testing and/or testing automation
    • Previous experience testing web-based and mobile applications
  • At least 1 year of experience with testing automation tools, using Cucumber or equivalent
  • Detailed and methodical approach to testing, tracking issues
  • Constantly evaluate and improve existing processes
  • Provide detailed feedback for developers for issues
  • Knowledge of design and UX principles for mobile interfaces
  • Organized, self-starting with excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Experience developing and maintaining unit/functional tests
  • Ability to effectively manage up, down, and across organizational structures

We especially want to work with you if you are good at:

  • Experience testing RESTful APIs, especially automated testing
  • Experience in developing for Android, iOS and/or Angular
  • Taking ownership of all products, processes and suggesting ways to improve
  • Experience with CI tools such as AWS CodePipeline
  • Being flexible and working well in a collaborative and fast-paced environment

Benefits

  • A competitive salary with benefits, including great medical, dental, and vision insurance
  • Generous PTO allowance, as well as sick leave, holidays, and parental leave
  • 401k
  • Equity potential
  • Free snacks, soda, coffee/tea, fruit
  • Fast-paced, supportive company environment
  • Opportunities to learn new technologies/frameworks
Apply now

About SHARE

SHARE is a microtransit service created for the trips you take the most. We partner with employers, schools, senior living, municipalities and healthcare facilities to provide a transportation solution backed by proprietary technology. At SHARE, we believe access to transportation means access to opportunities. We are creating the blueprint for transportation in Smart Cities.

Benefits

  • Flexible hours, work from home
  • Competitive salary with company-paid benefits
  • 401k plan
  • Company-provided Macbook
  • Generous, flexible PTO policy
  • Free snack and drinks
  • Equity

QA Tester at TruQC

Remote | International | Part-time
  • TruQC is an iPad and web application looking for a Quality Assurance tester.
  • We are looking for a detail-oriented person with a passion for quality.
  • Primary duties involve manual testing, regression testing, cross-platform (iPad and web) and cross-browser testing, test case management, logging and re-testing tickets.
  • We want to make sure our applications maintain their current high standards.
  • Experience with TestRail, MySQL and/or automated testing like Nightwatch or Selenium is a bonus.
  • Working on a Mac is required (to run Xcode) and we’re looking for a long-term, full-time teammate (part-time will be considered as well).

Our development group is a top-notch, remote and globally-distributed team, we enjoy monthly Hack Days and flexible schedules. We want you to have fun and enjoy working with a team that truly cares and wants to deliver nothing but outstanding quality. Join us and be a part of this awesome team!

items.content:
QA Advocate at IMS Global Learning Consortium

Remote | International

IMS Global, the world leader in EdTech interoperability and impact, is looking for an experienced, independent QA Advocate to join our distributed development team. This position is 100% remote, working as part of a small, multi-functional team. You must be confident at working alone, defining your own objectives and deliverables, be a self-starter, willing to ask questions and join the dots to deliver mission-critical solutions aligned to the organization’s roadmap, business goals, and timeframe

Responsibilities

  • Create and maintain test plans, test cases, test protocols, requirement traceability, and test reports
  • Work closely with the development team and product team to ensure quality acceptance criteria are met
  • Ensure efficient documentation and tracking of issues to improve the quality of our web applications
  • Research and recommend innovative, and where possible automated approaches for quality assurance tasks. Identify approaches that leverage our resources and provide economies of scale
  • Must be able to perform under tight timeframes and execute problem-solving skills

Qualifications

  • An undergraduate degree is required
  • Testing certification desired
  • 3-5 years of related industry experience

Skills

  • Experience configuring and using test automation tools, including writing test cases to improve the quality, stability, and scalability of web applications
  • Experience with Cypress, Google Cloud Platform beneficial
  • Solid understanding of web services, database performance, application security, and scaling
  • Willingness to acquire knowledge on new technologies to solve quality problems.
  • Excellent problem solving and analytical skills
  • Able to work independently, self-directed, and solutions-oriented from a remote location
  • Sound organizational and planning skills with solid attention to detail
  • Effective communication skills and excellent interpersonal skills
  • Ability to quickly assess technical needs and work with teams to design, implement and deploy test solutions
  • Provide strategic direction for the team’s testing efforts
  • Collaborate with teams on key business processes
  • Uses industry understanding to drive decision-making beyond best practices.
  • Ability to quickly triage problems under pressure, determine root cause and drive resolution
  • Knowledge of IMS Interoperability Standards and specifications a definite plus

items.content:
QA Automation Engineer, Trading Engine at Kraken

Remote

REMOTE – NORTH AMERICA

ENGINEERING

FULL-TIME REMOTE

By joining Kraken, you’ll work on the bleeding edge of bitcoin and other digital currencies, and play an important role in helping shape the future of how the world sees and uses money. At Kraken, we constantly push ourselves to think differently and forge new paths in a rapidly growing industry fraught with unexplored territory, which is why Kraken has grown to be among the largest and most successful bitcoin exchanges in the world. If you’re truly interested in pushing the envelope by disrupting an industry that some say cannot be disrupted, then we just might have the job meant for you. Kraken is a place for dreamers and doers – to succeed here, we firmly believe you must possess each in spades. Check out all of our job postings here https://jobs.lever.co/kraken.

Responsibilities

  • Build and enhance test automation frameworks for back-end testing using general-purpose programming languages like Go, Python, and C++
  • Build out automated regression test suite to achieve higher test coverage
  • Learn and understand the business domain and application architecture
  • Collaborate on test strategy by reviewing functional requirements and design specifications with development and product teams
  • Ensure timely completion of QA deliverables

Requirements

  • Comfortable writing not only automated tests but the frameworks and tooling that support them using high-level programming languages, particularly Go, Python, and C++
  • 3+ years QA experience in the financial sector
  • Very comfortable using Linux command line and local virtual machines
  • Familiarity with messaging protocols, particularly TCP sockets, HTTP(S), REST, WebSockets, Protocol Buffers
  • Keen interest in financial markets and familiarity with trading, particularly order types and collateral/margin trading
  • Prior experience implementing automated testing of distributed real-time systems
  • Well versed with issue-tracking tools such as Bugzilla and JIRA
  • Comfortable and productive working on a remote-first basis
  • BS in computer science or a related quantitative field

Check out all our open roles at https://jobs.lever.co/kraken. We’re excited to see what you’re made of.

We’re powered by people from the around the world with their own unique backgrounds and experiences. We value all Krakenites and their talents, contributions, and perspectives.

Apply for job

items.content:
QA Engineer

Company: iPresence
Headquarters: Canada
Visit company website

QA Engineer
Competitive Salary
UK or Spain - 100% Remote 
12 Month Contract

Please not that this role is a mix of manual and automated testing responsibilities
*Must be comfortable working in the Adult Niche Sector.

Here at iPresence our growth is dependent on hiring amazing people! Wherever in the world they work, everyone is rewarded for their contribution. Are you ready to develop your career in an exciting hyper growth company? 

iPresence was founded in Vancouver, BC to provide clients with a reliable partner to their online marketing and web development needs. We provide a wide variety of web services and predominantly specialise in high traffic websites. Just one of our websites receives 6.4 million views each month, making it one of Alexa’s Top 350 destinations in Canada.

Our vast in-house experience and expertise enables us to provide our clients with access to valuable resources to tap into their target audiences. We oversee millions of impressions per month through our network of websites building on our customized long term approach to customer success.

We also actively develop highly successful and profitable ventures of our own. We work on a variety of tech-based products which have evolved with market trends; adult-niche has always been at the heart of internet-usage and part of our rapid growth.

Requirements

  • 5+ years of experience as QA Engineer
  • 3+ years of experience with test automation, ideally with:
  • Java 10+ (streams, lambda expressions)
  • jUnit 5
  • Selenium 3
  • Excellent experience testing web applications
  • Demonstrable experience testing Restful APIs
  • Working knowledge of Git
  • Familiarity with Docker
  • Exposure to CI/CD solutions
  • Good understanding of HTTP and web applications' architecture
  • Good understanding of testing techniques (boundary value analysis, equivalence class partitioning, pairwise testing)
  • Ability to work unguided and own the entire testing process (starting with requirement definition and finishing with monitoring production performance)
  • Fluent in English

    • Desirable:

    • Previous remote experience
    • Working understanding of mocks/test doubles and fixtures
    • Familiarity with SQL, PHP, JavaScript
    • Familiarity with DataDog or similar metrics system
    • Please not that this role is a mix of manual and automated testing responsibilities

    Benefits

    • 100% remote. Work remotely from anywhere in the world and build your own schedule.
    • Coworking allowance
